org.primaresearch.dla.page.layout.physical.text

Interface LowLevelTextContainer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TextLine, TextRegion, Word

    public interface LowLevelTextContainer
    Container for low-level text objects (text lines, words, glyphs).
    Author:
    clc

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTextObject(LowLevelTextObject textObj)
      Adds a child text object
      java.lang.String composeText(boolean replaceTextContent, boolean recursive)
      Composes the text for this object using the child text objects.

      Returns a child text object

      Returns a child text object
      int getTextObjectCount()
      Returns the number of child text objects
      java.util.List<LowLevelTextObject> getTextObjectsSorted()
      Returns a sorted list of all text objects (sorts by x or y position, depending on the object type).

      Checks if there child text objects

    • Method Detail

      • hasTextObjects

        boolean hasTextObjects()
        Checks if there child text objects
        Returns:
        true if there are children, false if empty

      • getTextObjectCount

        int getTextObjectCount()
        Returns the number of child text objects

                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns a child text object
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Child text object

        Removes a child text object

      • getTextObjectsSorted

        java.util.List<LowLevelTextObject> getTextObjectsSorted()
        Returns a sorted list of all text objects (sorts by x or y position, depending on the object type).

      • composeText

        java.lang.String composeText(boolean replaceTextContent,
                             boolean recursive)
        Composes the text for this object using the child text objects.
        Parameters:
        replaceTextContent - If set to true the text content of this object will be replaced by the composed text (only if the composed text is not empty)
        recursive - If set to true all lower levels of text objects are used for the composition
        Returns:
        Composed text
